name: Hard Lyrical Trivia 2 Quiz / Test | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: "So gather you wits and hold on fast your mind must learn to roam"
questions.explanation:
Acid Queen.

	From The Who's 1969 classic album "Tommy".  When "Tommy" was adapted to the big screen in 1975, Tina Turner played the role of the Acid Queen.

questions.text: "Let the music be your master, may you heed the master's call"
questions.explanation:
Houses of the Holy.

	On Led Zeppelin's album "Physical Graffitti".  Ironically, the song "Houses of the Holy" wasn't included on the album "Houses of the Holy".

questions.text: "And now the sun's coming up, I'm riding with lady luck"
questions.explanation:
Old '55.

	This great tune can be found on The Eagles' album "On the Border".  The song wasn't written by any member of The Eagles; it was written by singer/songwriter Tom Waits.

questions.text: "He hears the silence howling, catches angels as they fall"
questions.explanation:
Locomotive Breath.

	From Jethro Tull's album "Aqualung".  The group is named after the 17th century inventor of the seed drill.

questions.text: "Living in hope of you, loving you now"
questions.explanation:
Day of the Dreamer.

	By Renaissance, on their album "A Song for All Seasons".  While Renaissance was never a very popular band, their fans (such as myself) remain devoted and faithful to their music.

questions.text: "Blood stains on my hands and I don't know where I've been"
questions.explanation:
Sweating Bullets.

	From Megadeth, on their album "Countdown to Extinction".  Lead singer/guitarist Dave Mustaine was originally with another heavy metal supergroup, Metallica.  When conflicts arose within Metallica, Dave went out and formed Megadeth.

questions.text: "Changing my life with the wave of her hand"
options: Every Little Thing She Does is Magic
questions.explanation:
Here, There, and Everywhere.

	From The Beatles, on their album "Revolver".  Just had to include this song since it's my personal favorite Beatle song.

questions.text: "From life alone to life as one, think not your journey's done"
questions.explanation:
Watcher of the Skies.

	From Genesis, on their album "Foxtrot".  Phil Collins wasn't the original drummer for Genesis.  He replaced the original drummer, John Mayhew, in 1970.

questions.text: "They just tell you that you're on your own fill your head all full of lies"
questions.explanation:
Sabbath Bloody Sabbath.

	From Black Sabbath, on their album "Sabbath Bloody Sabbath".  Before Ozzy Osbourne became a household name and reality TV star, he was the lead singer/songwriter for Black Sabbath.

questions.text: "She keeps a funny face, it's locked and bagged it's just outside the door"
questions.explanation:
Lady Picture Show.

	From The Stone Temple Pilots, on their album "Tiny Music...Songs From the Vatican Gift Shop". In 1993 the band played a show in NY City looking like the rock band Kiss (make-up and all!)
